text: I think this bill could potentially
represent the largest change in a
federal entitlement program needy in the
history of the country this would be
taking away a program that has existed
for 50 years and changing it into a very
different structure Medicaid is the
country's largest government health
insurance program it covers about 74
million Americans 4 out of 10 of every
American children 50% of all children
who are born are covered by Medicaid
there are more than 10 million Americans
with disabilities two-thirds of all
Americans who live in nursing homes are
being paid for by the Medicaid program
there are also many millions of people
in America who are just poor and
Medicaid is helping them pay for
treatment for opiate addiction or for
chronic disease care or just for basic
checkups most of the Medicaid dollars
actually don't go to poor Americans even
if you're a middle class person now with
a lot of savings you end up needing
piercing home care that's 100 thousand
dollars a year if you're a person who
has a child with a disability now or in
the future care for a child like that
and can be extremely expensive and
difficult to cover with commercial
insurance Medicaid is the program that
cares for those people Medicaid has run
a little bit differently in every state
and it often has a different name so a
lot of people who are covered by the
Medicaid program may not even realize
that Medicaid is where they get their
insurance what Obamacare did is expanded
Medicaid to cover more American
by saying that everyone in every state
who earned less than about $16,000 a
year could become eligible for Medicaid
if their state wanted to expand
about thirty-one states did and so it's
been a very large expansion of health
insurance coverage to low-income
Americans the details of the Republican
health care bill are still not final but
it's pretty clear that they're going to
be to really large changes to Medicaid
as part of this bill one it cuts way
back on the money that's available to
States to cover this new expansion
population the other big change is more
consequential but has received less
attention is that it will change the way
that the federal government pays for all
of the people who get medicaid it would
essentially put the federal part of that
spending on a diet
some independent estimates suggest that
the cut could be as much as one and for
federal dollars that states are getting
now they would no longer get you should
care about this because Medicaid is a
big program that serves a lot of people
and it needs to review one day
